events.name: Powershell User Group Meetup - PowerCLI
events.description: Hi All, I like to invite you all for our last meetup this year. Selva is a Consultant for Virtualization Projects working with Optimum solutions for SMBC - Horizon View implementation project assignment. He's been working in Infrastructure Implement and support for over 15 years across India, USA and Singapore. He is interested in Powershell and PowerCLi which simplifies the implementation / Configurations with no manual errors. Also, he has developed his own GUI tools for various activities to simplify admin jobs which includes vSphere Build, Horizon View configuration, View pool Setup, View Pool reports etc.. He always suggests if you repeat, automate it. This Technical discussion focuses on 1.  How to incorporate vSphere PowerCLI with daily operations, Implementation and Reports. 2.   The discussion on various Infrastructure implementation / configuration scenarios and how PowerCLI used as the solution. 3.  Complete demonstration of vCenter server Configuration using PowerCLI. (Add host, Create virtual switch etc) 4.  Latest updates of PowerCLI. There is possible we will have another session, will update soon. Hope to see you all.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Elves Workshop by FabCafe
events.description:
Elves Workshop by FabCafe
Saturday-Sunday, 10 -11 December 2016
10am-7pm ( last entry at 6pm)
Level 4 galleries 
Free. Register in Lobby 
Adult Supervision is required for children aged 6 and below.

The following craft stations require registration on a first-come, first-served basis.
1. Upcycle vinyl banners into A4 holders and iPad holders (20 mins): 12pm, 2pm, 4pm
- limited to 25 pax per session
2. Upcycle wine bottles into wind chimes (1 hr): 10.30am, 2.30pm, 5pm
- limited to 10 pax per session

This Christmas, we will be twisting, stamping, painting, snipping, to the art of upcycling. Be sure to walk away with cyanotype gift tags, ribbons, garlands and postcards from the craft stations. If you’re up for a challenge, upcycle vinyl banners into bags or purses, or try your hands at turning glass bottles into bells. Join us for a fun-filled weekend as we tinker around the Elves workshop to create handmade Christmas presents and gift wraps.

We'll also be showing Christmas Family Films all weekend. It's FREE. On a first-come, first served basis. Here is the lineup

Sat, 10 Dec
11am - Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer (1964)
1pm – Santa Claus is Comin’ to Town (1970)
4pm - Joyeux Noel (2005)

Sun, 11 Dec
11am - Little Drummer Boy (1968)
1pm – Frosty the Snowman (1969)
4pm – Mr. Magorium’s Wonder Emporium (2007)
